name: Sunlight
commonSymptoms: Itchy rash or hives on sun-exposed skin
Headache, nausea, or fever in severe cases
crossReactivity: Sometimes other forms of UV radiation

prevalence.general: Varies depending on the specific type of photosensitivity

commonSources: Exposure to ultraviolet (UV) radiation from the sun
treatment: Avoidance of sun exposure, protective clothing, sunscreen, medications

name: Cold
commonSymptoms: Hives or itchy welts on skin exposed to cold
Swelling of hands and feet upon warming
Severe, body-wide reaction (anaphylaxis) in rare cases
commonSources: Exposure to cold air, water, or objects
treatment: Avoidance of cold exposure, antihistamines, epinephrine for severe reactions

name: Water
commonSymptoms: Itchy hives appear within minutes of skin contact with water, regardless of temperature
crossReactivity: Own tears or sweat (in some cases)
commonSources: Contact with water
treatment: Antihistamines, barrier creams, UV light therapy

name: Heat
commonSymptoms: Small, itchy bumps or hives, usually on the neck, chest, and back
commonSources: Exposure to heat, sweating, hot showers or baths, exercise
treatment: Avoidance of heat and sweating, antihistamines

name: Pressure
commonSymptoms: Swollen, red welts on skin that has been under pressure
Deep swelling that can be painful and last for hours
crossReactivity: Tight clothing, prolonged sitting or standing
commonSources: Tight clothing, belts, bra straps, prolonged sitting or standing
testingMethods: Applying pressure to the skin with weights
treatment: Avoidance of prolonged pressure, antihistamines

name: Exercise
crossReactivity: Sometimes specific foods consumed before exercise
commonSources: Physical activity
treatment: Avoidance of triggering exercise, carrying an epinephrine auto-injector

name: Vibration
commonSymptoms: Hives, itching, and swelling shortly after exposure to vibration
commonSources: Vibrating machinery, tools, or vehicles
testingMethods: Applying a vibrating device to the skin
treatment: Avoidance of vibration, antihistamines

name: Dermatographia
commonSymptoms: Raised, red lines or welts appear on the skin where it has been scratched or rubbed
commonSources: Scratching, rubbing, pressure on the skin
testingMethods: Stroking the skin with a blunt object
treatment: Usually no treatment needed, antihistamines for itching

name: Nickel
commonSymptoms: Itchy rash at the site of contact
commonSources: Jewelry, belt buckles, snaps, zippers, keys, coins, mobile phones, eyeglass frames
treatment: Avoidance of nickel-containing items, topical corticosteroids

name: Gold
commonSymptoms: Itchy rash at the site of contact
commonSources: Jewelry, dental fillings
treatment: Avoidance of gold-containing items, topical corticosteroids

name: Cobalt
commonSymptoms: Itchy rash at the site of contact

prevalence.general: Relatively common, often co-occurs with nickel allergy

commonSources: Jewelry, metal tools, pigments in paints and ceramics, vitamin B12
treatment: Avoidance of cobalt-containing items, topical corticosteroids

name: Chromium
commonSymptoms: Itchy rash at the site of contact
commonSources: Leather products (tanning process), cement, metal alloys, paints
treatment: Avoidance of chromium-containing items, topical corticosteroids

name: Fragrance
commonSources: Perfumes, colognes, scented lotions, soaps, detergents, air fresheners
treatment: Avoidance of fragranced products, using fragrance-free alternatives

name: Latex
commonSources: Gloves, balloons, condoms, elastic bands, rubber products
treatment: Avoidance of latex products, carrying an epinephrine auto-injector

name: Cat Dander
commonSources: Cats
treatment: Avoidance, antihistamines, nasal corticosteroids, immunotherapy

name: Dog Dander
commonSources: Dogs
treatment: Avoidance, antihistamines, nasal corticosteroids, immunotherapy

name: Mold Spores
commonSources: Damp areas, basements, bathrooms, outdoors in decaying vegetation
treatment: Avoidance, antihistamines, nasal corticosteroids, immunotherapy

name: Tree Pollen
commonSymptoms: Sore throat due to postnasal drip
crossReactivity: Certain fruits and vegetables (oral allergy syndrome)
commonSources: Various tree species (e.g., oak, birch, maple, pine)
treatment: Avoidance, antihistamines, nasal corticosteroids, immunotherapy

name: Grass Pollen
crossReactivity: Certain fruits and vegetables (oral allergy syndrome)

prevalence.general: Common in late spring and summer

commonSources: Various grass species (e.g., ryegrass, timothy grass, Bermuda grass)
treatment: Avoidance, antihistamines, nasal corticosteroids, immunotherapy

name: Weed Pollen
commonSymptoms: Sore throat due to postnasal drip
crossReactivity: Certain fruits and vegetables (oral allergy syndrome)

prevalence.general: Common in late summer and fall

commonSources: Various weed species (e.g., ragweed, pollen, sagebrush)
treatment: Avoidance, antihistamines, nasal corticosteroids, immunotherapy

name: Dust (general)
crossReactivity: Often related to dust mites, pet dander, and mold
commonSources: Household dust containing dust mites, pet dander, mold spores, etc.
testingMethods: Allergy testing to specific components of dust
treatment: Avoidance, antihistamines, nasal corticosteroids

name: Smoke (Irritant, not always allergic, but can trigger reactions)
commonSources: Cigarette smoke, wood smoke, pollution
treatment: Avoidance of smoke exposure, inhalers (if asthmatic)

name: Perfume (see Fragrance)
commonSources: Perfumes, colognes
treatment: Avoidance of perfumes, using fragrance-free alternatives

name: Cosmetics (Specific Ingredients)
commonSources: Makeup, lotions, shampoos, conditioners
treatment: Avoidance of specific ingredients, using hypoallergenic products

name: Cleaning Products (Specific Chemicals)

prevalence.general: Common irritant reactions, true allergy less common

commonSources: Soaps, detergents, bleach, disinfectants
treatment: Avoidance of specific chemicals, using protective measures

name: Hair Dye
commonSymptoms: Rash on the neck, face, or ears
crossReactivity: Other dyes, paraphenylenediamine (PPD) is a common allergen
commonSources: Permanent and semi-permanent hair dyes
medicalName: Hair dye allergy or contact dermatitis
treatment: Avoidance of hair dyes containing the allergen, using alternative products

name: Formaldehyde
commonSources: Cosmetics, lotions, cleaning products, fabrics, glues
treatment: Avoidance of formaldehyde-containing products

name: Parabens
commonSources: Cosmetics, lotions, shampoos, conditioners, some medications
treatment: Avoidance of paraben-containing products

name: Acrylics

prevalence.general: Can occur from nail products, dental materials, and some fabrics

commonSources: Artificial nails, nail polish, dental prosthetics, acrylic fabrics
treatment: Avoidance of acrylic-containing products

name: Wool

prevalence.general: Irritant contact dermatitis is more common than true allergy

commonSources: Wool clothing, blankets, carpets
treatment: Avoidance of wool products

name: Lanolin
commonSources: Moisturizers, cosmetics, nipple creams
treatment: Avoidance of lanolin-containing products

name: Cement (Chromate)
commonSymptoms: Skin rash, itching, blistering on contact

prevalence.general: Common in individuals with occupational exposure

commonSources: Wet cement, mortar, grout
treatment: Avoidance of contact with wet cement, protective gear

name: Glues and Adhesives (Specific Chemicals)
crossReactivity: Depends on the specific chemical in the adhesive

prevalence.general: Can occur with various types of adhesives

commonSources: Household glues, industrial adhesives, adhesive bandages
treatment: Avoidance of specific adhesives

name: Rubber Accelerators (Chemicals in Rubber)
commonSymptoms: Skin rash, itching, blistering on contact
commonSources: Rubber gloves, tires, elastic, footwear
treatment: Avoidance of rubber products containing the specific chemical

name: Epoxy Resins
commonSources: Adhesives, paints, coatings
treatment: Avoidance of epoxy resins, protective gear

name: Formaldehyde Releasers (e.g., Diazolidinyl Urea)
commonSources: Cosmetics, lotions, shampoos
treatment: Avoidance of products containing formaldehyde releasers

name: Isothiazolinones (Preservatives)
commonSources: Paints, adhesives, cleaning products, cosmetics
treatment: Avoidance of products containing isothiazolinones

name: Propylene Glycol

prevalence.general: Relatively common irritant, true allergy less common

commonSources: Cosmetics, lotions, medications, processed foods
treatment: Avoidance of propylene glycol-containing products

name: Nonoxynol-9

prevalence.general: Common cause of irritant contact dermatitis

commonSources: Contraceptive gels, foams, and films
treatment: Avoidance of products containing nonoxynol-9

name: Poison Ivy, Oak, and Sumac
commonSources: Poison ivy, poison oak, poison sumac plants
treatment: Washing the affected area, topical corticosteroids, oral corticosteroids for severe cases
